page.title: 14THE CHILDREN'S FARM
page.content: The children's farm at Gt.Gaddesden covers 7 acres of what was ordinary farm land 2 yrs ago.It started as an arable farm then a poultry farm for about 20 yrs.Now farming is combined with RECREATION.The owners have lived here all their lives in 2 bungalows surrounded by animals.Approx 50000 people visited it last year including some nearby Buddhist monks.The most popular time is Easter and Oct.The 1st ANIMALS bought were ponies and pigs then various rabbits & sheep There are 10 types of animal,fed mostly on grain & hay.Their major expenses are wages,maintenance and veterinary,& about Â£40 a week on food. The owners want more land but at present this is not possible.They have FUTURE PLANS to improve the farm & make a souvenir shop.The farm has 6 STAFF & poultry farm employs 14.
